titles.title: Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Area Act
National Heritage Area Authorization Act of 2014
A bill to establish the Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Area in the State of Washington.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Landrieu with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 113-300.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 640.

term.name: Wilderness and natural areas, wildlife refuges, wild rivers, habitats

bill.summary:
7/15/2014--Introduced. Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Area Act - Establishes the Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Area in the state of Washington.
Designates the Mountains to Sound Greenway Trust as the local coordinating entity for the Heritage Area.
Requires the Mountains to Sound Greenway Trust to prepare and submit a management plan for the Heritage Area.
